channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Leopard spots and protein nanoclusters: How pattern rules could advance muscular dystrophy treatment
item.description: Although a leopard cannot change its spots, new research funded by the U.S. National Science Foundation uses the principles that govern patterns like ...

item.title: Ancient Andes society used hallucinogens to strengthen social order
item.description: Snuff tubes uncovered at Chavin de Huantar in Peru reveal how leaders used mystical experiences to cement their power.

item.title: Black tea and berries could contribute to healthier aging
item.description: Higher intakes of black tea, berries, citrus fruits and apples could help to promote healthy aging, new research has found.

item.title: Big problem for fusion energy solved
item.description: A new shortcut can help engineers design leak-proof magnetic confinement systems for fusion reactors 10 times as fast as the gold standard method, wit...

item.title: Specialized sponge recycles minerals from stormwater for reuse in agriculture and other industries
item.description: Funded by multiple grants from the U.S. National Science Foundation, researchers created a functional sponge that can soak up certain pollutants from ...

item.title: New study informs fire prevention strategies to save lives and property
item.description: U.S. National Science Foundation-supported research shows that fires in populated areas are three times more likely to lead to premature deaths than w...

item.title: Gorilla study reveals complex pros and cons of friendship
item.description: Friendship comes with complex pros and cons -- possibly explaining why some individuals are less sociable, according to a new study of gorillas.

item.title: A long and ongoing look at the secrets of human longevity and healthy aging

item.title: In extreme conditions, heat does not flow between materials. It bounces off.
